summary:
-Dawnguard required-
This is a heavy armor set (currently male only).
The armor is made up of Skyrim assets and includes some 100% new meshes and textures.
By SkyrimForDaWin
Original concept by monstrbox
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=5][b]Important Notes...[/b][/size]
-THIS MOD REQUIRES DAWNGUARD DLC-

-A kind modder has agreed to retexture the armor, keep an eye out for future updates-

[IMG]http://i1366.photobucket.com/albums/r777/SkyrimForDaWin/cb257f58-7e34-41a7-b392-5b83db0160b0_zps8ec2fd14.jpg[/IMG]

[size=5][b]Description[/b][/size]
This is a heavy armor set (currently male only).
The armor is made up of Skyrim assets and includes some 100% new meshes and textures.
Sorry but there is no weight slider for this armor, it will default to the 100% weight.

As of V1.1.0 this mod includes 2 weapons, a 2 handed "Berserker's Cleaver" (2H Sword) and a 1 handed "Berserker's War-Axe" (1H Axe)
The Armor and Weapons included in this mod should now work with the SkyRe Reproccer (if it doesn't, let me know and Ill take a look at it again)

Current Version Details.. (V1.1.0)
The armor is in the crafting list under "Orcish" and has the same stats as the "Dawnguard Heavy Armor" set (without the enchantments).
The names are as follows..
- Iron Wight, ArmWraps
- Iron Wight, Armor
- Iron Wight, Armor (Alternate version)
- Iron Wight, Boots
- Iron Wight, Helmet

The weapons are in the crafting list under "Orcish" and are based on the "Orcish Greatsword" and "Dawnguard Axe" (without the enchantments).
The names are as follows..
- Berserker's Cleaver
- Berserker's War-Axe

Misc. Details...
For anyone interested, the name "Isen Wiht" I made up using a list of viking name components (found on Wikipedia) and comes from the "Elder Futhark" language used by Vikings... it translates to "Iron Wight", which I feel fits the Viking Berserker theme of the armor quite well..
The Berserker is generally described as... Strong (like iron), Reckless and Immune to physical attacks & pain (like a wight).. And that is my reasoning behind the name.

Please feel free to upload any screen shots of the mod.

[size=5][b]Installation[/b][/size]
Install with NMM
 - or - 
extract the folders in the 7z archive to your skyrim directory

Activate "Armor Of The Iron Wight.ESP" in your load-order.

[size=5][b]Uninstallation[/b][/size]
use NMM to uninstall
 - or - 
Delete the following file(s) & folder(s)...
.../skyrim/data/Armor Of The Iron Wight.ESP
.../skyrim/data/meshes/SkyMeshes/Berserker/
.../skyrim/data/textures/SkyTextures/Berserker/

[size=5][b]Credits[/b][/size]
SkyrimForDaWin - Meshes & Textures.
monstrbox - Original Armor Concept & Feedback.

Bethesda for the Skyrim assets used to make the mod.

I would also like to thank...
Reaper9111 - for tips and tricks for textures.
Nightasy - for his awesome tutorials for making armor in skyrim.. Check them out at [url=http://www.nightasy.com/]NightasyTutorials[/url]
Wikipedia - for providing me with valuable information related to Vikings, Berserkers and the Viking naming system.

[size=5][b]Permissions[/b][/size]
Please contact SkyrimForDaWin (myself) for anything directly related to the mod.
[/center]
author: SkyrimForDaWin
